summary: dow jones breaks 24,000 points for first time .
shares in daily mail owner plunge .
kellogg 's vows to cut sugar in cereals .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for another day on business live .
do join us again tomorrow from 6am to get all the latest news , analysis and reaction to what 's going on in the business world .

documents.title: female governor
text: it would be `` fantastic '' if the next governor of the bank of england was a woman , the chair of the house of commons treasury committee has said .
nicky morgan , whose committee regularly grills governor mark carney and his senior colleagues , said it was `` really important '' to see women in the top jobs .
mr carney is due to step down as governor in june 2019 , and no successor has yet been named .
speaking to the house magazine about the prospect of a woman getting the job , former cabinet minister ms morgan said : `` i think it would be fantastic .
in the same way that i think having female prime ministers is really important , and women in the cabinet , it would be great to see a female governor of the bank of england . ''

documents.title: dow closes above 24,000 for first time
text: the dow jones broke the 24.000 mark for the first time on thursday and closed at 24,272.35 , a rise of 332 points or 1.39 % .
meanwhile the s & p 500 ended the day at 2,647.25 , up 21 points or 0.81 % .
the tech-heavy nasdaq gained 50 points or 0.73 % to finish at 6,873.97 .
the indexes were given a boost by the prospect that president trump 's tax reforms may be passed .
earlier republican us senator john mccain had said he would back the tax bill .

documents.title: whatsapp service resumes after worldwide outage
text: messaging app whatsapp said on thursday that users around the world had been unable to access its service for a brief period , but that access for its 1 billion daily users had since resumed .
the outage was most acute in northern europe and brazil but lasted less than an hour , according to downdetector.com , which tracks disruptions across telecommunications services .
california-based whatsapp , which facebook bought for $ 19bn in 2014 , is among the most popular messaging services in the world .

documents.title: politics of envy
text: let 's hope ubs bank chief sergio ermotti does n't mind making himself unpopular .
but given what labour 's jeremy corbyn said earlier about bankers , it 's not great timing .
ermotti thinks efforts to rein in bankers ' pay is fuelled by envy among less well paid officials and regulators .
the swiss bank boss told a financial times conference : i think this discussion is made by people who are maybe frustrated that they do not make that kind of level of money . ''
critics are `` trying to minimise the issues on a very populistic level , '' he said .

documents.title: corbyn warns 'greedy ' banks
text: jeremy corbyn has hit back at investment bank morgan stanley , telling the firm it is right to regard him as a threat .
the labour leader 's comments come after the us-owned bank released a report warning that the prospect of his party taking power was a bigger threat to the uk economy than brexit .

in a video message released on social media in response , mr corbyn pledged that a labour government would reform banking regulation to rein in the `` speculators and gamblers '' who crashed the economy in 2008 .

a report from morgan stanley 's european equity team earlier this week warned investors : `` from a uk investor perspective , we believe that the domestic political situation is at least as significant as brexit , given the fragile state of the current government and the perceived risks of an incoming labour administration that could potentially embark on a radical change in policy direction . ''
mr corbyn responded : `` these are the same speculators and gamblers who crashed our economy in 2008 .
and then we had to bail them out .
their greed plunged the world into crisis and we 're still paying the price .

`` nurses , teachers , shop workers , builders , just about everyone is finding it harder to get by , while morgan stanley 's ceo paid himself £ 21.5m last year and uk banks paid out £ 15bn in bonuses . ''

documents.title: hacker jailed
text: a russian man who ran a sophisticated computer hacking network which stole at least £ 2m from the bank accounts of uk businesses has been jailed for nine years .

vugar mollachiev , 37 , of berkeley gardens , north london , was sentenced to nine years imprisonment at southwark crown court for conspiracy to defraud and money laundering , the metropolitan police said .
evidence from a previous cyber crime investigation identified mollachiev as being heavily involved in cyber criminality and online fraud .
scotland yard said mollachiev and his associates used their technical knowledge to infect computers in businesses across the uk and europe , enabling them to defraud businesses and banks .

documents.title: ikea in dispute over single mum
text: italian unions are in dispute with swedish retail giant ikea over a single mother sacked because she struggled with early morning shifts .
marica ricutti said she could not start work at 7am because she had to take her two young children - one of them disabled - to school .
the italian retail workers ' union filcams cgil has protested outside the ikea store in corsico , milan .
ikea says ms ricutti decided her own working hours without warning managers .
ms ricutti , 39 , has worked at the corsico branch of ikea for 17 years , holding some senior roles .
she told the italian daily la repubblica ( in italian ) that she had received verbal assurances from managers about her hours ,

documents.title: fed official in bitcoin warning
text: digital currencies like bitcoin could pose a threat to financial stability as they gain wider use , a senior us federal reserve official says .

randal quarles , newly-installed fed vice chairman for supervision , said in a written statement this evening : `` the 'currency ' , or asset , at the centre of some of these systems is not backed by other secure assets , has no intrinsic value , is not the liability of a regulated banking institution , and in leading cases , is not the liability of any institution at all .
`` while these digital currencies may not pose major concerns at their current levels of use , more serious financial stability issues may result if they achieve wide-scale usage , '' said quarles .
bitcoin has soared in value , and yesterday hit a record $ 11,400 .

documents.title: gm sets out road ahead
text: general motors has laid out its vision for self-driving vehicles , telling investors it planned a commercial launch of fleets of fully autonomous robo-taxis in 2019 , in a challenge to rivals such as alphabet 's waymo .

america 's biggest carmaker has been focused on rolling out self-driving cars since its estimated $ 1bn acquisition of start-up cruise automation in early 2016 that provided a toehold in the nascent industry .
carmakers and rivals such as waymo and uber have poured billions into the competitive industry , with each player hoping to gain first-mover advantage .
robo-taxi services are seen as the main use for most self-driving vehicles , including gm 's chevrolet bolt .

`` if we continue on our current rate of change we will be ready to deploy this technology , in large scale , in the most complex environments , in 2019 , '' gm president dan ammann said on a conference call .

documents.title: venezuela oil 'purge '
text: venezuelan authorities have arrested two of the most influential men in charge of the country 's oil business .
former oil minister nelson martinez and former president of state oil company pdvsa eulogio del pino were detained on thursday .
venezuela 's attorney general tarek william saab says both men have been named by witnesses in a graft scandal involving pdvsa 's us subsidiary citgo .
last week six executives from the company were also arrested .
analysts say venezuela 's oil sector is going through a purge by president nicolas maduro .
on sunday , martinez and del pino were fired from their roles and replaced by a general .
venezuela 's economy relies heavily on oil .
earlier this month the country missed some debt payments , raising concerns it could default on its international obligations .
author: Daniel Gallas
BBC South America business correspondent

documents.title: us markets move higher
text: wall street continues to motor ahead on hopes that donald trump 's tax reform proposals will be approved .
the dow jones index is now up 350 points - or 1.5 % - to 24,290.7 points , having passed for the first time the 24,000 mark at the start of trading .
the s & p 500 is up 1 % at 2,653.9 .

documents.title: russia joins opec deal
text: russia and some other non-opec members have agreed to join an extension of production cuts .
on thursday opec nations agreed to keep production curbs in place for another nine months until the end of 2018 , iraq 's oil minister said after talks in vienna .
the accord among the 14 members of opec and 10 others , including russia , was first struck a year ago and was already extended once until the end of march .
the aim is to reduce a global excess in supply that has pushed oil prices lower and left a huge hole in the finances of producer nations , despite making life easier for buyers of crude .
the situation has been helped by improved economic conditions , notably in energy-hungry china , that have boosting demand for crude .

documents.title: we 're out !
text: tv businessmen peter jones ( right ) and theo paphitis ( left ) have sold the gift experience company red letter days , which they saved from collapse , to rival smartbox .
both companies sell balloon flights , spa breaks and other activities for people to give each other as presents .
the two stars of bbc two 's dragon 's den bought the company out of administration in 2005 .
mr jones said they were selling the company , for an undisclosed price , because `` the time felt right '' .
red letter days now has more than half a million customers a year .

documents.title: blankfein on bitcoin
text: lloyd blankfein 's disdain for crypto-currencies shows no sign of waning , despite bitcoin surging past $ 11,000 yesterday - only to sink about 20 % .
it remains a favourite vehicle for fraudsters , the goldman sachs chief tells bloomberg .
any investment that is so volatile should not be part of a sensible investment strategy , he adds .

documents.title: lloyds says payment problems sorted
text: lloyds bank says problems today with standing order payments have been sorted .
here 's a statement from the bank : we are aware that some customers experienced delays with standing orders , which resulted in payments being made later today than normal .
they have now been processed and credited to accounts and we are very sorry for any inconvenience caused . ''

documents.title: ftse falls
text: some heavyweight members of the ftse 100 helped to drag down the index by 0.9 % , to 7,326.6 points .
astrazeneca , prudential and glaxosmithkline were among several firms to fall more than 2 % .
mediclinic was the biggest riser , up 4.7 % after a broker `` buy '' recommendation .

documents.title: us tax plan wins key supporter
text: the republican drive to push sweeping tax legislation through the us senate up momentum on thursday with the endorsement of senator john mccain .

mccain , who was instrumental in defeating the republican push to overturn obamacare earlier this year , said the bill was `` far from perfect '' but would boost the economy and provide tax relief for all americans .
hopes of a tax deal has helped push wall street into fresh record territory on thursday .

documents.title: sterling strengthens
text: sterling continues to rise on hopes of progress in the brexit negotiations .
the pound is now above $ 1.35 , not seen since the end of december .
sterling hit a two-month dollar high on wednesday on reports the uk had offered to pay up to €50bn ( £ 44bn ) to settle its eu `` divorce bill '' .
the times also reported on thursday that the uk was close to a deal concerning the border with northern ireland and the republic of ireland .

documents.title: white house 'has plan to replace tillerson '
text: secretary of state rex tillerson and a former boss of oil giant exxon could be replaced by cia chief mike pompeo , us media report .

documents.title: opec agrees production deal
text: the oil producer group opec has agreed to extend output cuts until the end of 2018 as it tries to finish clearing a global glut of crude while signalling it could exit the deal earlier if the market overheats .
the producers ' current deal , under which they are cutting supply by about 1.8 million barrels per day ( bpd ) in an effort to boost oil prices , expires in march .
opec has been meeting in vienna .
the group is due to meet non-opec producers , led by russia , later today .

documents.title: a graphic illustration of two record-breakers
text: with the dow jones breaking the 24,000 level for the first time , and the broader s & p at a fresh high , here 's what the two share markets have been doing since before the financial crisis .

documents.title: four-horse race for finance job
text: finance ministers from four countries have thrown their hats into the ring to replace jeroen dijsselbloem ( above ) as head of the eurogroup of finance ministers , a job that will involve carrying out major reforms to the euro currency .

candidates from portugal , latvia , slovakia and luxembourg are bidding for one of europe 's most senior jobs , with a final choice expected at the next meeting of the 19 eurogroup ministers on monday in brussels .

documents.title: bull run continues
text: meanwhile , the s & p 500 also opened at its highest since 2007 , at 2,636 .
the rally was supported by a rebound in technology stocks and progress on president donald trump 's tax-cut plan .

documents.title: dow breaks record - again
text: continuing the theme of markets and prices breaking records , wall street 's dow jones index has breached the 24,000 level for the first time .
the index opened up 0.4 % at 24,036 points .

documents.title: water watchdog bites
text: the water watchdog has called out water firms including thames water for `` shortcomings '' in the way they handle data , saying customers may not be able to trust company information .

ofwat named and shamed bristol water , dee valley water , southern water and thames water for lagging behind their peers in its annual company monitoring framework report , which is meant to hold companies to account and `` challenge them to improve transparency '' .

while it reported overall industry improvement , ofwat said that data handling shortcomings at those four firms meant the regulator and customers can not be sure the information presented is `` complete and accurate '' .

thames water said it was `` disappointed '' by the regulator 's decision to classify the company in its lowest assessment category : `` we will be working hard to rebuild trust and achieve self-assured status as quickly as possible . ''

documents.title: bitcoin fall continues
text: the price of bitcoin continues to slip .
after reaching a record $ 11,434 yesterday , the price is down to $ 9021.85 , according to coindesk .
the fall tempers an astronomical rise for the cryptocurrency in recent months - bitcoin was up almost 1,100 % year-to-date on wednesday

documents.title: rbs closes 'bad bank '
text: the memories of the financial crisis continue to fade , to some degree , with the news that rbs has closed its `` bad bank '' .
there are £ 16.1bn of assets remaining in its capital resolution division , which have now been folded back into the core bank .
chief executive ross mcewan says closing the bad bank is a `` key moment '' for rbs .
`` it has taken nearly 10 years to undo the consequences of the global ambitions pursued by rbs in the run-up to the crisis , '' he says .
`` what we have achieved is unprecedented for the banking industry .
we have gone from a bank with a balance sheet bigger than uk gdp to the smaller , safer bank we are today . ''

documents.title: sears cuts losses
text: sears , the us retailer that also owns kmart , has cut its third quarter loss by almost $ 200m to $ 558m after closing dozens of underperforming stores .
that was enough to send sears shares , which have more than halved this year , surging 28 % in pre-market in new york .
`` the improvement is reflective of the success of the strategic priorities we outlined earlier this year , '' said sears ' owner eddie lampert .
however , like-for-like sales at sears stores plunged 17 % in the three months to 28 october and it was n't much better at kmart , where sales were down 13 % .
total sales fell $ 1.4bn to $ 3.6bn compared with the same quarter last year .

documents.title: mediclinic leads ftse 100 risers
text: the ftse 100 has trimmed losses and is now down 10 points at 7,382 .
top of the risers is mediclinic , the south african private hospital group , whose shares are up 4.3 % at 563.5p following an upgrade from broker jefferies to `` buy '' from `` underperform '' .
in contrast , pharmaceuticals giant astrazeneca is leading the fallers , down 1.7 % at £ 48.16 .
strong results have propelled marston 's to the top of the gainers on the ftse 250 , with the pub group up 9.6 % to 114.9p .
however , the wider ftse 250 is off almost 100 points at 19,960 .
dmgt , the owner of the daily mail , has clawed back some earlier losses , but its share price is down 22 % at 544p after it warned of a tough year ahead .

documents.title: coroner criticises whirlpool
text: a coroner has called on whirlpool to take action to prevent future deaths after two men were killed in a fire caused by a tumble dryer .
bernard hender , 19 , and doug mctavish , 39 , died following the blaze at a flat in llanrwst , north wales , on 10 october 2014 .
coroner david lewis recorded a narrative verdict and ruled the blaze was caused by an electrical fault in the door switch of a hotpoint tumble dryer .
he has published a report for the prevention of future deaths , which has been issued to the us white goods manufacturer , whose brands include hotpoint , indesit and creda .

in the report , mr lewis raised concerns that evidence from witnesses for whirlpool during the hearing had been `` defensive and dismissive '' , adding : `` i did not emerge from the hearing confident that whirlpool 's risk assessment processes have fully identified or appreciated the extent of the risk of fire [ and its potential consequences ] . ''
whirlpool has come under criticism following a safety alert over the fire risk posed by faulty hotpoint , indesit and creda tumble dryers .
a whirlpool spokesman said it would carefully review and consider the coroner 's findings in this case .

documents.title: what 's next for the lse
text: in response to activist shareholder the children 's investment fund , the london stock exchange will now have to publish a circular to shareholders where it will set out why it believes that its chairman donald brydon should stay on at the company .
however , on wednesday , when the lse announced that its chief executive xavier rolet was leaving immediately , it also said that mr brydon would not stand for re-election as chairman in 2019 .

documents.title: care home funding gap may force closures , say cma
text: the uk watchdog has warned that the country 's care homes are struggling with a £ 1bn funding gap which could force sites to close .

the competition & markets authority ( cma ) said resident fees paid by councils failed to meet care home costs - fees of private care home residents were 40 % higher on average than the amount paid by councils .
the cma also said that is taking a number of care homes to court to clamp down on those charging families for `` extended periods '' after a resident has died , or demanding unfair upfront fees .
`` the simple truth is that the system can not continue to provide the essential care people need with the current level of funding .

without substantial reform to the way that councils pay and commission care , and greater confidence that the costs of providing care will be covered , the uk also wo n't be able to meet the growing needs of its ageing population . ''

documents.title: 'no change to our position '
text: in a letter to the london stock exchange , sir christopher hohn , founder of the children 's investment fund , said : `` the requisitioned ordinary resolution to remove donald brydon as director of the london stock exchange should proceed to a general meeting by no later than 28 december 2017 .
`` there is no change to our position on this . ''
it has , however , withdrawn a resolution asking for xavier rolet to stay on as chief executive until 2021 .
mr rolet resigned on wednesday following an intervention by mark carney , governor of the bank of england .

documents.title: breakinglse investor refuses to back down
text: the children 's investment fund , which holds a 5 % stake in the london stock exchange , has refused to withdraw a request for an extraordinary general meeting where it is seeking to oust chairman donald brydon .

documents.title: energy price gap remains above £ 300
text: the price gap between big energy suppliers ' ty default tariff and the cheapest deals on the market remains above £ 300 .

figures , published by energy regulator ofgem , show that the gap between the `` big six '' suppliers ' standard variable tariff and the cheapest deals was £ 308 in october - the same as the previous month .
there have been various moves among the biggest suppliers to scrap these expensive tariffs .
however , critics have suggested that poor-value deals could remain , but just under a different name .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: not so magic mushrooms
text: oh dear .
france has found traces of radioactive cesium on mushrooms imported from russia , according to the country 's nuclear authority .

asked about the impact of a cloud of radioactive pollution coming from russia in october , asn chairman pierre-franck chevet told the french senate that levels of radioactive ruthenium 106 in the air had posed no safety threat to french citizens , but that controls on imported food products had been strengthened .
`` the latest information i have is that it seems traces of cesium have been found on mushrooms that would have come from russia , '' he said .

documents.title: compensation at last for courageous couple
text: more on lloyds 's settlement with paul and nikki turner .

the tenacious couple tried to report what was going on at the reading branch of hbos , which lloyds rescued during the financial crisis , to the banks as well as regulators , politicians and the police .
their publishing business zenith was run into the ground as a result of a £ 245m loans scandal at the reading office .

mrs turner said earlier this year : `` they defrauded us , denied for 10 years that the fraud had happened , ignored the debt from the fraud and tried to evict us 22 times in order to cover up the fraud . ''

documents.title: slippery slope ?
text: with the latest competitive skiing season taking to the slopes once again and the next winter olym just around the corner , the sport is enjoying a period of high-profile media coverage .
skiing is more than just an exciting sport , it is also seen as a glamorous leisure industry that brings together healthy sporting activity , tourism and hospitality .
but , like another sport that has traditionally been associated with a certain level of economic affluence - golf - it finds itself facing a number of challenges and opportunities .

documents.title: eurozone unemployment falls
text: eurozone unemployment has fallen slightly to 8.8 % in october - its lowest level since january 2009 -official figures showed thursday .
the figure for the eu as a whole was 7.5 % - the lowest since november 2008 .
eurostat also said inflation in the eurozone ticked up to 1.5 % in november from 1.4 % in october .
that was below expectations for an increase to 1.6 % and is still below the ecb 's 2 % target .
eurostat 's flash estimate for november does not include a month-on-month calculation .

documents.title: push the button
text: after hitting $ 11,000 yesterday , bitcoin has had a bit of a rollercoaster ride and is now at about $ 9,800 , according to coindesk .

banks should speed up the introduction of instant payments , whereby money is received immediately and around the clock , to counter the allure of digital currencies such as bitcoin , a european central bank director says .

cryptocurrencies - which can be used for instant electronic payments - have gained prominence in the financial debate and some central banks such as sweden 's are even considering the introduction of their own version of them .
yves mersch , a member of the ecb 's executive board , is dismissive of these digital tokens , but urges banks to offer an alternative .

`` banks need to implement instant payments as soon as possible and provide an alternative narrative to the ongoing public debate on the alleged innovation brought by virtual currency schemes , '' he told a conference in rome .

documents.title: disney reacts to 'whitewashing ' claims

the live-action adaptation of the 1998 animated movie will tell the tale of the famed chinese heroine hua mulan .
several hollywood films have faced criticism in recent months for featuring white actors in asian roles .
thousands took part in an online campaign calling for an asian actress to be cast as mulan .

`` lloyds banking group is sorry for the significant personal distress the turners have suffered and acknowledges their vital role , over more than a decade , campaigning tirelessly for justice for all the victims of the criminal conduct at hbos reading impaired assets office , '' the joint statement said .

documents.title: southern cheer
text: the firm that owns southern rail says it is now `` wholly focused '' on improving service for long-suffering passengers after train drivers ended their lengthy dispute .

go-ahead said in a trading update that performance on the southern service had `` consistently improved '' since union action eased this year , most recently with the vote by drivers in the aslef union earlier this month to accept a deal to end its dispute with southern over driver-controlled trains .
however , the rmt union has refused to call off its action against southern over the move .

go-ahead , which runs southern through its govia thameslink railway ( gtr ) joint venture with french firm keolis , said cancellations on the franchise were down 8 % and punctuality levels had improved by 16 % since the start of the year .
the government announced plans yesterday to split thameslink , southern and great northern franchises when govia 's contract expires in 2021 .

one opec delegate says that they will agree on an extra nine months .

documents.title: consumer confidence slips
text: a measure of uk consumer sentiment fell this month to its lowest since just after last year 's brexit vote , and business morale also softened , as households and firms took a darker view of the economic outlook .
the gfk consumer confidence index fell 2 points to -12 in november - its lowest since july 2016 and worse than analysts expected .
`` sadly there 's no festive cheer , '' said joe staton of gfk .
`` household jitters following the recent interest rate hike , squeezed incomes , higher inflation and economic uncertainty have dampened the consumer mood across the uk . ''
the economy has slowed this year as higher inflation - largely due to the fall in the pound after the brexit vote last year - pushed up costs for households and businesses .

documents.title: upbeat marston 's reports rising profit
text: it 's the day for beer and pub chains to report results .
marston 's is doing somewhat better than its bigger rival greene king .

the purveyor of pedigree has about half the number of greene king 's outlets - some 1,570 and employs 14,500 people .

the boss , ralph findlay , had this to say : we have achieved strong revenue growth and higher earnings , despite increasing employment and property costs while political and economic uncertainty is likely to continue , we remain confident . ''
shares in marton 's rose 4.7 % to 109.8p in early trading .

documents.title: something fishy at morrisons

the supermarket says : `` morrisons is recalling traditional chicken & mushroom pie because a small number of packs have been identified to contain fish pies .

text: the ftse 100 has opened 21.58 points lower at 7,371.98 .

documents.title: frc promises to explain
text: the financial reporting council also concedes in its report that it has not always been clear about its decision-making process - or why , in this case , it cleared kpmg of misconduct over its audit of hbos before the bank 's collapse in 2008 .

the council says : `` public interest in and criticism of the outcome of our enquiries and investigation has highlighted a concern that we do not sufficiently explain the reasons for our decisions to close cases .
`` in future , where there is a clear public interest to do so and subject to any applicable legal restraints , we will publish a summary of our reasons for closing an investigation . ''

documents.title: greene king profits slip
text: greene king , the brewery and pubs chain famous for its ipa and abbot ale , reports an 8 % slip in adjusted profits to £ 128m for the first six months of the year .
turnover fell by 1.2 % to £ 1bn .
shares in the company tumbled 5.5 % to 510p in early trading .

the company describes a `` challenging '' first half - with all sorts of extra expenses : `` we are facing unprecedented cost increases of £ 60m this year , including the national living wage , the apprenticeship levy and duty increases . ''
they come as consumer confidence remains subdued and a 13 % fall in people eating out for the three months to october compared with the same period last year .

documents.title: watchdog 'not proactive ' on hbos audits
text: in september , the financial reporting council cleared accountancy firm kpmg of misconduct in relation to its audit of hbos 's financial results in the run-up to its collapse .
today , the frc has published a report at the request of the treasury select committee into how it exonerated kpmg of any wrongdoing .

the council concedes it was not proactive in making inquiries into the audit of hbos 's figures and relied too heavily on information provided by uk banking regulators : `` it was not right to regard them as the lead regulator in relation to audit .
we should have adopted a more proactive role and acted more quickly . ''

documents.title: charges hit dmgt profits
text: full-year profit at daily mail publisher dmgt fell 13 % to £ 226m .

however , on the statutory pre-tax measure things are slightly gloomier : £ 206m in impairment charges against its genscape , xceligent and sitecompli businesses have resulted in a loss of £ 112m for the 12 months to 30 september .
chief executive paul zwillenberg said dmgt delivered a `` resilient underlying performance during the year and made good progress against our strategic priorities '' .
shares are down almost 10 % this year .

founder vicky graham has said the business - which sells handmade donuts at market stalls around the capital and employs four people - would not exist without instagram , its head of public policy michelle napchan tells today .
it has 60,000 instagram followers and makes 90 % of its sales through the facebook-owned platform , ms napchan adds .

documents.title: uk house prices rise
text: house prices rose by 2.5 % in the year to november , according to nationwide .
between october and november , they increased by 0.1 % and the average price of a home is £ 209,988 .

robert gardner , nationwide 's chief economist , says : `` low mortgage rates and healthy rates of employment growth are providing support for demand , but this is being partly offset by pressure on household incomes , which appears to be weighing on confidence . ''

documents.title: above the law ?
text: google is being taken to court , accused of collecting the personal data of millions of users , in the first mass legal action of its kind in the uk .
it focuses on allegations that google unlawfully harvested information from 5.4 million uk users by bypassing privacy settings on their iphones .
the group taking action - google you owe us - is led by former which ?
director richard lloyd .
he tells today there is a feeling that silicon valley giants such as google are `` above the law '' .
mr lloyd wants the company to admit it breached data protection laws by putting advertising-tracking cookies on the devices of safari users in 2011 and 2012 .
the browser , most commonly found on iphones , is set by default to block such cookies .
but do n't users now expect a personalised service online he is asked ?
people do n't realise that 's the basis of the deal , '' mr lloyd responds .
google argues that the case has no merit .

kellogg 's oli morton says : `` i think for us the question is much deeper than that which is what consumers are playing back to us is that they want to make healthier choices in the morning and they want them to taste great '' .

he says : `` i would suggest that the government targets simply play back what consumers are actually wanting so for us it is actually about taking a leadership stance because we think the consumer is always going to be much further ahead . ''
